intro: Pupalia brachystachys, commonly known as the small-stemmed pomegranate, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and woody. The fruit, though small, is edible and has a tart flavor, making it a valuable plant in both horticulture and local diets.
